text: Yes, I’ve seen folks do it a few times. I don’t know if I have permission to share some of the examples I’ve seen, but I will check if I can link out to one as an example

Hello all,

How I can update custom object inner record using HubSpot api? can you please help me.

Thanks !!
Cool <@U7SL518D6>! Can you elaborate on how this interfaces with HubSpot CMS? Always interested to see how people are handling that architecture.

PWAs are mostly a front-end thing. They basically added a service worker js file and a manifest.

To make an installable PWA your serviceworker needs to at least be able to provide a basic offline HTML page when not connected to the internet. For that page you should put all of your CSS, images and JS in the HTML itself to make it easier to serve that page. Once you’ve got that and want to go more complicated there are some libraries you might be able to use that make building more sophisticated service workers easier. I’d suggest looking into them, as it’s very easy to accidentally build a service worker that kinda borks your PWA, if you’re not careful.
